Continuation of yesterday's question regarding the staff "card" using a repeater module:

doesnt look like the repeater switch has been toggled on which will change your hubl markup.
unsure where jon’s answer is so sorry if this is redundant
quick question, we can take a contact field for and email and then use hubl in that email to assign it to an array and split it and output with a for loop correct?
theoretically yes. in reality - you should definitely test that email before you try sending it. I could see the preview being different than the actual sent email
Can you create a repeater field in an html module? We have a client who is not using the design manager but wants the repeater field functionality.

Using the page editor you cannot create fields.

You can only create fields through the design manager. You can create them inside of modules, or if you have a legacy template you can have a HubL module, which contains the HubL tag.

another exception is blog posts, you can use HubL to add fields to blog posts as well.
Hey Jon, thanks for responding. We are in the “template” side of HubSpot, but the clients template is all code (not using modules) is there hubl markup to create a repeater for this situation?

to clarify something before answering. The template side  is the design manager, it encompasses both coded and drag n drop templates.
If they have a coded template, you could either create a custom module and have a repeater inside of it, or there’s kind of a ghetto trick where you can have an input field for a number(for number of items you want to add to the page)

Then you can do a for x in previous input field

new field for whatever content you want repeated, but the field name needs to be generated by the loop, it cannot match any repeated items or it will not work properly.

I advise just making a custom module and using the custom module’s tag. way faster way easier
